intro: Rabelaisia philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine rabelaisia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
